meanings.def: willing to use their power to do dishonest or illegal things in return for money or to get an advantage
examples: It was seen as the only way to overthrow a corrupt regime.
They promised to seek out the corrupt officials who had accepted the bribes.
one of the most notoriously corrupt city councils
They had been engaged in corrupt practices.
The whole system is inefficient and corrupt.

meanings.def: containing changes or faults, and no longer in the original state
examples: The file on the disk seems to be corrupt.

meanings.def: to have a bad effect on somebody and make them behave in a way that is not honest or moral
examples: He was corrupted by power and ambition.
the corrupting effects of great wealth

meanings.def: to change the original form of something, so that it is damaged or made less good in some way
to cause mistakes to appear in a computer file, etc. with the result that the information in it is no longer correct; (of a computer file, etc.) to start containing mistakes
examples: The program has somehow corrupted the system files.
The disk will corrupt if it is overloaded.
